cards.name: Hisuian Voltorb
cards.text: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

attacks.name: Cheerful Charge
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you go second, and only during your first turn. Choose up to 2 of your Benched Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Kricketune

abilities.name: Swelling Tune
abilities.text: Your Grass Pokémon in play, except any Kricketune, get +40 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Swelling Tune Ability at a time.

cards.text: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

cards.name: Magmortar
cards.text: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Boltsplosion
attacks.text: If Electivire is on your Bench, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Oricorio

abilities.name: Lesson in Zeal
abilities.text: All of your Fusion Strike Pokémon take 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Lesson in Zeal Ability at a time.

cards.text: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

attacks.name: Glistening Droplets
attacks.text: Put 5 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Raging Freeze
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon during their last turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Wave Veil
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

cards.name: Keldeo
cards.text: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

attacks.name: Line Force
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Electivire
cards.text: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.

attacks.name: Explosive Bolt
attacks.text: If any of your Benched Magmortar have any damage counters on them, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: High-Voltage Current
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Toxtricity

abilities.name: Maximum Downer
abilities.text: If all your Pokémon in play are Fusion Strike Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon VMAX in play get -30 HP.

cards.text: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.

cards.name: Mew

abilities.name: Mysterious Tail
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck, reveal an Item card you find there, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokémon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.

cards.name: Lunatone
cards.text: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Moon Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Deoxys
cards.text: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokémon. It appears where auroras are seen.

attacks.name: Photon Boost
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fusion Strike Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Diancie

abilities.name: Princess's Curtain
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Basic Pokémon.

cards.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Comfey

abilities.name: Flower Selecting
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card in the Lost Zone.

cards.text: Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates itself with them. For some reason, flowers won't wither once they're attached to a Comfey.

cards.name: Solrock

abilities.name: Sun Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Lunatone.

cards.text: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

cards.name: Absol
cards.text: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Swirling Disaster
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Thievul

abilities.name: Baffling
abilities.text: If your opponent has 2 or fewer Prize cards remaining, whenever your opponent plays a Supporter card from their hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Benched Pokémon V.

cards.text: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

cards.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Giga Magnet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it's being controlled by some mysterious being.

cards.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Tempting Tune
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, shuffle your deck, then put that card on top of it.

cards.text: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

cards.name: Latias

abilities.name: Red Assist
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Latios.

cards.text: It can telepathically communicate with people. It changes its appearance using its down that refracts light.

attacks.name: Dyna Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon VMAX.

cards.name: Hisuian Goodra

abilities.name: Metal Lodging
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to each of your Basic Pokémon that has any Metal Energy attached by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V.

cards.text: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy— it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

cards.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Sudden Transformation
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Basic Pokémon in your discard pile, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

cards.name: Dunsparce

abilities.name: Mysterious Nest
abilities.text: Colorless Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Weakness.

cards.text: When it sees a person, it digs a hole with its tail to make its escape. If you happen to find one, consider yourself lucky.

cards.name: Miltank

abilities.name: Miracle Body
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon V.

cards.text: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it's been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.

attacks.name: Rout
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Bibarel

abilities.name: Industrious Incisors
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand.

cards.text: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Duskull
cards.text: If it finds bad children who won't listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it's said.

attacks.name: Perplex
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Bidoof

abilities.name: Carefree Countenance
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Pikachu

abilities.name: Pika Dash
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Whimsy Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

cards.name: Paras
cards.text: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Poochyena
cards.text: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Mareep
cards.text: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You'll want to pet it because it's cute, but if you use your bare hand, you'll get a painful shock.

cards.name: Leafeon VSTAR

abilities.name: Ivy Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Entei V

abilities.name: Fleet-Footed
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw a card.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Burning Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Simisear VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fireball Fever
attacks.text: You may discard up to 5 cards from the top of your deck. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Ember Star
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Suicune V

abilities.name: Fleet-Footed
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw a card.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Lumineon V

abilities.name: Luminous Sign
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Return
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

cards.name: Glaceon VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Icicle Shot
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Crystal Star
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Raikou V

abilities.name: Fleet-Footed
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw a card.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lightning Rondo
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Zeraora VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reactive Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

attacks.name: Max Fist
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zeraora VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crushing Beat
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm Star
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon 4 times. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) For each time you chose a Pokémon, do 60 damage to it. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Mewtwo VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psy Purge
attacks.text: Discard up to 3 Psychic Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 90 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Star Raid
attacks.text: This attack does 120 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon V. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Deoxys VMAX

abilities.name: Protective DNA
abilities.text: All of your Pokémon take 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VSTAR (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Deoxys VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Psychic Javelin
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon V. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Star Force
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Hatterene VMAX

abilities.name: Witch's Domain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move up to 2 damage counters from your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Smite
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Zacian V

abilities.name: Roar of the Sword
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Storm Slash
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Drapion V

abilities.name: Wild Style
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each of your opponent's Single Strike, Rapid Strike, and Fusion Strike Pokémon in play.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Tail
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Darkrai VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Abyss
abilities.text: During your turn, you may put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dark Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Darkness Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Hisuian Samurott V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Basket Crash
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Hisuian Samurott VSTAR

abilities.name: Moon Cleave Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may put 4 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Merciless Blade
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 110 more damage.

cards.name: Hoopa V

abilities.name: Two-Faced
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is Psychic and Darkness type.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shadow Impact
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Zamazenta V

abilities.name: Regal Stance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 5 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Regigigas VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Guardian
abilities.text: During your turn, if your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. They discard that Pokémon and all attached cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Hisuian Zoroark VSTAR

abilities.name: Phantom Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 7 cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ticking Curse
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Adaman
cards.text: You can use this card only if you discard 2 Metal Energy cards from your hand. Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Cheren's Care
cards.text: Put 1 of your Colorless Pokémon that has any damage counters on it and all attached cards into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Colress's Experiment
cards.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put 3 of them into your hand. Put the other cards in the Lost Zone.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Cynthia's Ambition
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 5 cards in your hand. If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, draw cards until you have 8 cards in your hand instead.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Gardenia's Vigor
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Grant
cards.text: During this turn, your Fighting Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). During your turn, if this Grant is in your discard pile, you may discard 2 cards, except any Grant, from your hand. If you do, put this Grant into your hand. (This effect doesn't use up your Supporter card for the turn.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Irida
cards.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon and an Item card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Melony
cards.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon V. If you do, draw 3 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Raihan
cards.text: You can play this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn. Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Roxanne
cards.text: You can use this card only if your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining. Each player shuffles their hand into their deck. Then, you draw 6 cards, and your opponent draws 2 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Origin Forme Palkia VSTAR

abilities.name: Star Portal
abilities.text: During your turn, you may attach up to 3 Water Energy cards from your discard pile to your Water Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Subspace Swell
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.name: Origin Forme Dialga VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Star Chronos
attacks.text: Take another turn after this one. (Skip Pokémon Checkup.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Giratina VSTAR
cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lost Impact
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to your Pokémon in the Lost Zone.

attacks.name: Star Requiem
attacks.text: You can use this attack only if you have 10 or more cards in the Lost Zone. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is Knocked Out. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.name: Arceus VSTAR

abilities.name: Starbirth
abilities.text: During your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

cards.text: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Trinity Nova
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon V in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.
